nodes.bodyText: We might want to prevent addresses like the federation here. Not a big deal, but would just waste resources

I could be wrong on this, but I feel that we have an unexpected change in consensus here.
If we send a transaction from a wp2pkh without presenting the witness, before the activation of the rskip170, it used to reject the transaction and send the money back because with no sender the transaction wouldn't be lockeable, but now it does not seem to send the money back. Or, in general, non lockeable transaction because there's no sending, before rskip170 used to generate a rejection release while it does not happen anymore.
Here: refund is only created when there's a pegininstructionexception only after the rskip170 activation

Add new pegin_btc event, replaces lock_btc event after RSKIP 170 activation

Removed also tests from BridgeSupportTestPowerMock that were duplicated in BridgeSupport

commit.message:
Create OP_RETURN parser

Create interface and implement it on PegInstructionBaseClase from where all the versions will extend.
Create multiple exceptions to manage errors.
Add unit test for PeginInstructions classes and update BtcTransactionFormatUtilsTest as it now contains the method extractOpReturnData
Create class to contain all the raw transactions and rename some tests

Applying improvements in PeginInstructions code
- Reorder PeginInstructionsBase class methods
- Move extractOpReturnData to PeginInstructionsProvider class
- Make getBtcRefundAddressFromData method protected
- Add override annotation to getRskDestinationAddress and getProtocolVersion methods on base class
- Add op_return data validation on PegInstructionsProvider
- Fix some test and add validations
- Make buildPeginInstructions Optional
- Rename getBtcRefundAddress to parseBtcRefundAddress and make it void
- Move NoOpReturnException class to pegininstructions package
- Add some debug info
- Remove unnecessary data validation length from provider
- Move getBtcRefundAddress logic to parseAdditionalData on PeginInstructionsV1

Remove data length validation from provider
Validate data on extractProtocolVersion

Create PeginInformation class

This class is responsible for parsing a btc lock tx and obtaining the rsk address to where the funds should be transferred, and a BTC refund address in case the lock can not be completed. This information is obtained from peg-in instructions included in an output with OP_RETURN in the tx, or from the tx sender using BtcLockSender class.
Update BridgeSupport to use new PeginInformation class when performing peg-ins
Peg-in protocol version uses 1 byte instead of 2

Add prefix verification to peg-in instrcutions parser.

Peg-in instructions parser now verifies that a prefix is included in the payload indicating the OP_RETURN output is for RSK. Updated tests to create transaction objects for each case instead of using raw txs.
Implement peg-in process for protocol version 1

Update lockBtc event in BridgeEventLogger to handle the case when sender is null

If senderBtcAddress is null because the sender could not be obtained, then put "Undetermined" string in the sender field of the event
Rename BtcLockSender TxType enum to TxSenderAddressType
Rename txIsProcessable to txIsProcessableInLegacyVersion in BridgeUtils
Generte rejection release to refund address instead of sender
Check if RSKIP 170 is active before parsing peg-in instructions
Try to refund sender if lock tx is invalid

Add new pegin_btc event, replaces lock_btc event after RSKIP 170 activation

Removed also tests from BridgeSupportTestPowerMock that were duplicated in BridgeSupport
